hero.headline: Accenture Forms 30,000-Person AI Army: Anthropic Partnership Creates Largest Claude Code Deployment Force
hero.summary: Accenture and Anthropic announced the formation of the 'Accenture Anthropic Business Group' on December 9, 2025—a dedicated force of approximately 30,000 professionals trained on Claude technologies. This multi-year expansion puts Claude Code at the center of enterprise software development across industries, with teams already building solutions for organizations worldwide.
hero.whyItMatters: This isn't just a partnership announcement—it's the professionalization of AI-assisted development at scale. 30,000 trained Claude practitioners entering enterprise engagements means prompt engineering and agentic coding workflows are becoming standardized consulting practices. For individual developers, this validates Claude Code skills as enterprise-grade credentials.

topStories.title: Anthropic's Official Skills Repository Explodes: 912 Stars Today
topStories.summary: Anthropic released their official Agent Skills repository, providing a standardized way to extend Claude Code capabilities. With 912 stars gained today, developers are rapidly adopting the official skill format for building custom AI agent extensions.

topStories.title: Context Engineering Is Replacing Prompt Engineering: The New Frontier
topStories.summary: Industry experts are declaring 2025 the year 'context engineering' superseded prompt engineering. With MCP now under the Linux Foundation and agent systems requiring sophisticated context management, the single biggest predictor of AI success isn't prompt wording—it's context curation.

topStories.title: byLLM: Open-Source Framework Eliminates Manual Prompt Engineering
topStories.summary: A new open-source framework enables seamless LLM integration with a single line of code by automatically generating context-aware prompts. Developers using byLLM completed tasks 3x faster and wrote 45% fewer lines of code in user studies.

topStories.title: CocoIndex: Data Transformation Framework for AI Gains 407 Stars
topStories.summary: A new Rust-based data transformation framework designed specifically for AI pipelines is trending on GitHub. CocoIndex offers ultra-performant incremental processing for RAG systems and data pipelines—a critical need as AI applications require increasingly sophisticated data preparation.

trendingRepos.name: exo-explore/exo
trendingRepos.description: Run your own AI cluster at home with everyday devices—phones, laptops, desktops, even smartwatches. Distributed LLM inference without expensive GPUs. 1,327 stars gained today.

trendingRepos.name: anthropics/skills
trendingRepos.description: Official Anthropic repository for Agent Skills—the standardized format for extending Claude Code capabilities. 912 stars gained as developers adopt the official skill specification.

trendingRepos.name: cocoindex-io/cocoindex
trendingRepos.description: Data transformation framework for AI built in Rust. Ultra-performant incremental processing for RAG pipelines, vector databases, and AI data preparation workflows.

trendingRepos.name: danielmiessler/Fabric
trendingRepos.description: Open-source framework for augmenting humans using AI. Modular system for solving problems using crowdsourced AI prompts that work anywhere. 329 stars today.

trendingSkills.name: Skill Developer
trendingSkills.description: Create and manage Claude Code skills following best practices. Covers skill structure, YAML frontmatter, trigger patterns, hooks, and debugging skill activation for building custom AI assistants.

trendingSkills.name: Zero-to-Hero
trendingSkills.description: Rapidly become a codebase expert across any project size or language. Valuable for understanding complex systems that power AI tools and development workflows.

trendingSkills.name: Debug Detective
trendingSkills.description: Apply systematic debugging approach for ANY codebase, ANY language, ANY bug type. Essential for troubleshooting AI model integrations and coding assistants.

trendingSkills.name: API Integration
trendingSkills.description: Master third-party API integration across languages—essential for connecting Claude and other AI services into production systems with proper error handling and rate limiting.

newMcpServers.name: sqlite-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Transforms SQLite into an AI-ready database engine with advanced analytics, text and vector search, geospatial capabilities, and intelligent workflow automation. Business intelligence layered on SQLite.

newMcpServers.name: gmail-mcp
newMcpServers.description: Gmail operations via MCP using IMAP/SMTP with app password authentication. List messages, search emails, and send messages directly from AI assistants with proper security.

newMcpServers.name: playwright-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Automate browsers and APIs from Claude Desktop, Cursor IDE, and more. Full Playwright capabilities for web testing, scraping, and browser automation through MCP.

newMcpServers.name: linkedin-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Access LinkedIn from AI assistants—scrape profiles and companies, get recommended jobs, and perform job searches. Set your li_at cookie to authenticate.

notableHooks.name: Context Injection on Prompt Submit
notableHooks.description: Automatically adds current time, git branch, environment info, and relevant context when you submit prompts. Hook stdout gets injected as context before Claude processes your request.

notableHooks.name: Permission Auto-Approval
notableHooks.description: Automatically grants permissions based on conditions—auto-approve documentation reads, allow specific shell commands, or grant MCP tool access without prompting every time.

notableHooks.name: Stop Continuation Check
notableHooks.description: Uses LLM-evaluated prompts to check if Claude should actually stop or continue working. Block stoppage and request continuation if tasks aren't complete using prompt-based hooks.

tuiTools.name: yazi
tuiTools.description: Blazing fast terminal file manager written in Rust based on async I/O. Image previews, plugin system, and vi-like keybindings. Updated Dec 20, 2025.

tuiTools.name: textual
tuiTools.description: The lean application framework for Python—build sophisticated UIs with a simple Python API. Run apps in terminal and web browser. 30.7k stars, updated Dec 18.

tuiTools.name: bottom
tuiTools.description: A customizable graphical process/system monitor for the terminal written in Rust. Modern replacement for top/htop with visual graphs and resource monitoring.

tuiTools.name: dive
tuiTools.description: Tool for exploring each layer in a Docker image. Analyze and optimize your container images by inspecting layer contents and identifying wasted space.

I'll never use n8n the same......
AI News: GPT-5.2, Devstral 2, Boom Superpower, MCP Nonprofit and more!
Master Gemini 3.0 for Work in 12 Minutes (2026)

highlights: LSP (Language Server Protocol) tool for go-to-definition, find references, and hover documentation
Terminal-setup support for Kitty, Alacritty, Zed, and Warp terminals
Ctrl+T shortcut in /theme to toggle syntax highlighting on/off
Gemini 3 Flash now available with 78% SWE-Bench score at Flash pricing
Enhanced authentication with /auth logout and credential management
Persistent 'Always Allow' policies for shell and MCP tool executions
GPT-5.2-Codex with 56.4% SWE-Bench Pro and enhanced cybersecurity capabilities
Context compaction for long-horizon work on large codebases
Stronger vision capabilities for UI mockups and technical diagrams

notableQuotes.quote: This expanded partnership demonstrates our commitment to putting Claude Code at the center of the enterprise software development lifecycle, training approximately 30,000 professionals on Claude technologies.
notableQuotes.author: Accenture

notableQuotes.quote: The single biggest predictor of AI agent success in 2025 isn't model selection—it's context engineering. Prompt engineering is now a subset of context engineering, perhaps a tiny fraction of total context in production agent systems.
notableQuotes.author: Anthropic

notableQuotes.quote: Developers using byLLM completed tasks over three times faster and wrote 45% fewer lines of code. The framework has seen over 14,000 downloads in one month since going open source.
notableQuotes.author: TechXplore

prompt: Generated via /generate-news slash command. Claude fetches data from 9 sources in parallel (aggregated RSS feed, 7 web searches, GitHub trending via trotd, SkillsMP feed, Claude Code/Gemini CLI/Codex changelogs, Docker MCP catalog via mcp-find, YouTube trending API, Claude Code hooks docs, awesome-tuis list), deduplicates against the past 14 days of digests, then curates into structured JSON.
